resources.string:
CARROT HALWA

 INGREDIENTS

 1 Kg Carrot
 1/2 litre Milk
 2 Green cardamoms
 5-7 tbsp Ghee
 5-7 tbsp Sugar 
 2 tbsp Raisins 
 1 tbsp Almonds, shredded 
 2 tbsp Dates, chopped 

 HOW TO PREPARE 

 1.Peel and grate the carrots.
 2.Simmer in milk with the cardamom until liquid evaporates. 
 3.Heat ghee in a heavy pan and add the carrot mixture. 
 4.Cook over a gentle flame for 10-15 minutes. 
 5.Stir in sugar and continue cooking until the halwa turns deep reddish color. 
 6.Stir in dried fruit and serve.

PANNER BUTTER MASALA


 INGREDIENTS

 Dried Kashmiri Red Chillies
 Butter, Oil and Cream
 Onions and Tomatoes
 Ginger Garlic Paste
 Cashew nuts
 Spices
 Kasuri Methi
 

 PREPARATION

 Bouquet Garni: Start with wrapping the spices in a muslin or cheesecloth to make a bouquet garni. This helps add all the flavour without having to fish out the spices one by one later Cook the kashmiri chillies, onion, tomato, cashew, poppy seeds and spices together till the tomatoes are soft and pulpy. This is the base of the gravy Remove the bouquet garni (whole spices) and the blend the onion tomato paste to really smooth. You can add some water if required Simmer the gravy along with powdered spices and salt in butter for 10-15 minutes till you can see a little oil floating to the top Smoke the gravy with my dungar method. This takes the gravy to the next level! Add kasuri methi, paneer and cream, cook for a minute or two and you are done!

CHICKEN TIKKA MASALA 

 INGREDIENTS

 1. Chicken
 2. Yogurt
 3. Tomato sauce
 4. Cream
 5. Masala paste

 HOW TO PREPARE

 1. MASALA PASTE: Pulse all ingredients into a food processor until smooth.
 2. MARINATE CHICKEN: Cut the chicken into bite sized pieces. Marinate with 1-2 tablespoons of masala paste and the yogurt for about 30 minutes in the fridge.
 3. Cook the chicken in batches, undisturbed, until each piece is nice and browned on the outside.
 4. Add 2-3 tablespoons of masala paste to the same skillet. Stir fry for a few minutes. Add the tomato puree and browned chicken; simmer for 10-15 minutes.
 5. FINISH: Stir in cream or coconut milk. Season with salt.

KULCHA BREAD 

 INGREDIENTS

 1. 1½ cups Maida (all purpose flour) + for dusting
 2. 1/2 teaspoon Baking Powder
 3. 1½ teaspoons Sugar
 4. 1½ tablespoons Curd (yogurt)
 5. 1½ tablespoons Oil
 6. 3 tablespoons Milk
 7. Salt to taste
 8. Warm Water, to knead the dough
 9. 1 tablespoon Black Sesame Seeds or Kalonji Seeds (onion seeds)
 10. 3 tablespoons finely chopped Coriander Leaves, optional
 11. Butter, as needed

 HOW TO PREPARE 

 1. Sift the maida flour, baking powder and salt together. Add sugar, curd and oil. Add milk and mix well.
 2.
